results.title: Cinema
results.brief_description: Afghanistan, “Switzerland of Asia”, has about twelve million inhabitants and twelve cinemas. To one of these cinemas, the admission is one afghani. (Accorded the Award of Merit, Oberhausen).

results.title: Cinderella: a lesson in compromise
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
This “moral tale” discusses the concept of greed and how things should be distributed equally. Two children fight over the proceeds of a product they made and need their uncle to teach them how to fairly share the profit. The uncle uses an excerpt from a Disney cartoon (Lucifer the cat and Cinderella story) in order to convey his message across. Cast includes Philip Abbott, Ruth Lind and Dylan Paiz.

results.title: Cinder in your eye
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit and Phillip Mark-Law
results.brief_description: An atmospheric and poetic treatment of the restoration of railway engines accompanied by the natural sounds and music of the banjo and harmonica. Locomotives and historic rolling stock once again reign in Tasmania’s superb countryside in this journey into nostalgia.

results.title: Cinco anos [interactive]
results.brief_description: Interactive online work about Barcelona, containing a montage of multi-layered colourful images using hand-drawn animation, newspaper cuttings and stills to convey a sense of the local community and the use of street art.

results.title: Cincinnati automatic cycle press brake
results.brief_description: Shows the machine in action, from forming ‘flat’ sheets of metal on high speed or bending metal perfectly on slow speed. The machine has been revolutionary for workers helping them get the job done faster.

results.title: Cigarette smoking
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”.
This film shows the increase in cigarette smoking in the United States of America since World War I and how this increase has led to a large jump in the incidence of lung cancer. It also shows other diseases directly attributed to cigarette smoking.

results.title: Cicada
results.creator_credit: Division of Motion Pictures Extension Service
results.brief_description: The life cycle of the cicada, or, as it is commonly known, the seven-year locust. In spring, the pupa emerges. Time-lapse photography shows us the transition from pupa to winged insect, including the shedding of the pupal shell. The winged insect lays eggs, from which young insects hatch and drop to the ground to begin their underground larval stage of development. In the spring, they will emerge in the pupal stage, and the life cycle will commence again. Narration by J.A. Hyslop.

results.title: Churchill: voice of a prophet
results.creator_credit: Nielsen-Ferns, New York Times Productions and Don Thompson
results.brief_description: Examines Churchill’s life immediately after the Second World War and his loss to Labour in the general election; his predictions of the dangers of the Soviet Bloc; his anti Soviet speeches throughout the USA; his visits to India in 1947 for the granting of independence; his return as Prime Minister in 1951 and his death in 1965. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.
